events.event_name: China Stocks Gain for Second Session
events.description: Mainland Chinese equities advanced for a second straight session on Wednesday.
A private survey showed China’s services sector growth accelerating to a three-month high in January.

facts.fact_text: The Shanghai Composite rose 0.85% to close at 4,102, while the Shenzhen Component added 0.21% to 14,156.

evidences.evidence_text: The Shanghai Composite rose 0.85% to close at 4,102, while the Shenzhen Component added 0.21% to 14,156.

facts.fact_text: China’s services sector growth reached a three-month high in January.

evidences.evidence_text: a private survey showed China’s services sector growth accelerating to a three-month high in January

facts.fact_text: Contemporary Amperex rose 4.9%, Kweichow Moutai rose 3.4%, and China Spacesat rose 3.3%.

evidences.evidence_text: Gains were led by Contemporary Amperex (4.9%), Sungrow Power (1.6%), Goldwind Science (0.4%), Kweichow Moutai (3.4%), and China Spacesat (3.3%).

claims.claim_text: Tech shares are under pressure due to global concerns that AI-driven disruption could undermine traditional software business models.

evidences.evidence_text: tech shares remained under pressure amid global concerns that AI-driven disruption could undermine traditional software business models.

claims.claim_text: Services sector growth was supported by stronger new orders and solid foreign demand.

evidences.evidence_text: supported by stronger new orders and solid foreign demand.

evidence.evidence_text: a private survey showed China’s services sector growth accelerating to a three-month high in January
tech shares remained under pressure amid global concerns that AI-driven disruption could undermine traditional software business models.
supported by stronger new orders and solid foreign demand.
